Title: Feature Stories - From ancient times to today, Greece's great scientific heritage
Teaser: More than two and half millennia ago, Thales of Miletus sought to explain the physical world in terms of the natural rather than the supernatural, earning him the title of the father of science. Centuries later Aristotle and his student Theophrastus classified and named plants and animals, laying the foundations for botany. Hippocrates, meanwhile, is considered the father of Western medicine.
